pr_title: Adds call to interceptor to disable double URL encoding for S3 contro…

timeline.bodyText: This makes it a protected API, not an internal API, since it's being used by another module. That will make it such that we can't change it in the future. If it's simple, can we just copy it?
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText:
I discussed with Zoe and this was the solution we agreed on yesterday. You have a valid argument, but also S3 doesn't necessarily distinguish between S3 data plane and control plane API calls in terms on how they receive and process requests. Also we already have a dependency on S3.
However I think I can be persuaded to copy it since it IS very small and dependencies are potentially expensive in the future...
replies.author: cenedhryn

replies.bodyText:
I think if we're going to share it and make it protected we should move it to a place that we can get to it without needing to go through the S3 module. Maybe in the auth module, since that's where it's used? We'd want to pick a more specific name as well: DisableDoubleUrlEncodingDuringSigningInterceptor?
I'm still on "team just copy it", but you and Zoe outnumber me :).
replies.author: millems

timeline.message: Adds call to interceptor to disable double URL encoding for S3 control requests in addition to S3 requests
Adds call to interceptor to disable double URL encoding for S3 control requests in addition to S3 requests
